node.title: Clean up `col_to_pattern` logic
node.body:
- Remove redundancy, increase code sharing.
- Explicitly let `sep=None` handle `list` cell in multicategorical columns
- More type checking of canonicalized `col_to_pattern` to raise informative errors.

I deliberately made so, since the input here is supposed to be canonicalized dictionary. By default, col_to_pattern should be an empty dictionary.

node.title: Feat : Create checkbox component
node.body:
<!--

Title Naming Conventions:

- Start with a capitalized prefix followed by an imperative form of a verb, just like a commit message.
- Refer to the "Commit Convention" for the prefix:
  https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-convention.

Example:
- Fix: Resolve memory leak in data processing module
- Feat: Add two-factor authentication
- Refactor: Improve state management in React components
- Docs: Add Windows setup instructions

-->

## Overview

<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes introduced by this PR. -->
Create Checkbox component based on shadcn [Checkbox](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/checkbox)

## Changes

<!-- List the changes -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- Added `Checkbox.tsx` to `src/components/ui` directory.
- Added `CheckboxUsageExample.tsx`
- Added export of `Checkbox` in `src/components/ui/index.ts` 
- Added `icon_check.svg` to `assets/images/icons`
- Added color `white` to Icon component variant

## Review points

<!-- List the points you would like to be reviewed in detail and the points you are not confident about. -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- Since there weren't any size variation, I didn't add variants for checkbox, so checkbox rectangle is fixed to be 24px square, and check icon is fixed to be 14px. We can override it any time with `className` tho. **Should I make size variant already, considering the desktop design?**
   

## Screen Captures

<!-- Add screenshots or screen recordings of the changes -->
<!-- Necessary for UI changes -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->


https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/assets/99339182/31220b71-7c09-4270-8b37-13f8834e5fdb



## References

<!-- List all the URLs of the references (documents, articles, youtube videos, etc.) that you used to complete this task -->
<!-- If you have referred to responses from ChatGPT or other AIs, please include the links to the conversations if possible -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- [shadcn Checkbox component](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/checkbox)


## Assignee Checklist:

<!-- You can tick the checkboxes if not applicable -->

- [ ] The naming convention of the PR title is correct (See the comment at the top of this template)
- [ ] The base branch is correct (See: [Types of Branches](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#types-of-branches))
- [ ] The branch name follows the [Branch Naming Conventions](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#branch-naming-conventions)
- [ ] The correct assignees and reviewers have been designated for this PR
- [ ] The coding style follows the [Coding Style Guide](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/STYLEGUIDE.md)
- [ ] All the related issues are associated with this PR
- [ ] All criteria in the associated issues are met (please tick the checkboxes)
- [ ] My changes do not generate new warnings or errors (especially in the console)

## Reviewer Checklist:

<!-- You can tick the checkboxes if not applicable -->

- [ ] Double-check the "Assignee Checklist"
- [ ] The code follows the generic best practices and our [Coding Style Guide](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/STYLEGUIDE.md)
- [ ] The code is well-commented and easy to understand
- [ ] The UI changes accurately reflect the provided design

node.bodyText: There is no point from me to mention. Thanks!

@kanta1207
Thank you for your work! I left some comments. Please kindly take a look at them.
Also could you tick the checklist, please? So we will be able to double-check them.
For your question,

Should I make size variant already, considering the desktop design?

I don't think you should define variants for the size, until it becomes necessary.
This <div> should be the <Label> tag, so that the entire card can toggle the checkbox.
I recommend against defining styles not in the provided design. Disabled checkboxes typically have different styles, such as a grayish color.
Does the color primary-foregroud exist?

Does this peer have any effects?
https://tailwindcss.com/docs/hover-focus-and-other-states#styling-based-on-sibling-state

The current border width looks a bit too thin to me.
I played around and figured out border-[1.2px] and border-[1.5px] looked nicer.
In fact, the border width of the original svg image in Figma is around 1.2px.
1px:

1.2px (this is the closest value to the original design):

1.5px:

I personally prefer 1.5px, but if you stick to the Figma design, around 1.2px would be the best.

I thought we might be able to utilize it, but now I feel like we can remove it!!
It doesn't have any effect itself, it can have some effect when checkbox component is used with other sibling element. But anyway we can pass peerclass anytime to CheckboxRoot only when it's needed.
I removed it in the latest commit!

It was complete mistake of mine, sorry!
I removed it!

Do you think it's better to add some typical style for disabled state?
Since it's currently not designed in wire frame, I removed disabled:cursor-not-allowed in the latest commit!

Thank you for pointing out!! I was a bit blind about it, sorry 😓
I didn't have much preference between 1.2px and 1.5px , so I decided to follow the figma, 1.2px!
Thus I set it as 0.075rem since we're using rem in our code base

Thank you for updating!
In general, disabled checkboxes are usually styled in a design. However, since our current features do not require disabled checkboxes, I suppose there is no need to define a style for them for now. When adding a new style to our code, it would be the time to ask the designers to add a new design to Figma.

Using rem for such small values may not be effective... I have never seen that before.
I asked ChatGPT, and here is the conversation:
https://chat.openai.com/share/a85682c7-e98b-4ab9-9f84-a0a0edc9d88d
Could you research more about it, please?

Use px when you need fixed-size elements that won't change, such as for borders or shadows.
Your suggestion and also this article below make sense. I think I'm going to use px for this
https://www.shecodes.io/athena/28078-when-to-use-ems-rems-and-px-in-css#:~:text=Use%20px%20when%20you%20need,their%20browser's%20default%20font%20size.
Other references:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33997943/0-1-rem-border-width-renders-differently-on-chrome-and-safari
https://kheohyeewei.medium.com/in-short-when-to-use-px-em-and-rem-b2de94e1b829
I see that it still remains 👀
@kanta1207 I understand that you have made an update, but it's not what I intended. First, we should always avoid using the plain
Thank you for updating and providing additional information :)
You mean peer on line 28 remains? I suppose it's removed in this commit, and I couldn't find it in the current branch
Sorry, I overlooked it... I suppose keeping it is acceptable if it's intentional, but thanks for updating!
Addressed in this PR: #191

node.title: Proposal: New CSS selector engine for jsdom
node.body:
`nwsapi` has been working great so far, and I appreciate the developer's hard work, but `nwsapi` is unable to support Selectors Level 4 properly at the moment.
You can find many selector-related bug reports in the `jsdom` issues.

Therefore, I recommend changing to a different CSS selector engine [dom-selector](https://github.com/asamuzaK/domSelector).
It supports many features of the Selectors Level 4 and also the Shadow Hosts.
Ref [Supported CSS selectors](https://github.com/asamuzaK/domSelector#supported-css-selectors)

# Benchmark results

```
npm run benchmark
```

|API|nwsapi|dom-selector|
|:--------|:--------|:--------|
|closest()|jsdom x 126,133 ops/sec ±0.75% (73 runs sampled)|jsdom x 7,449 ops/sec ±13.28% (64 runs sampled)|
|matches()|jsdom x 120,369 ops/sec ±8.31% (65 runs sampled)|jsdom x 8,507 ops/sec ±7.84% (60 runs sampled)|
|querySelector()|jsdom x 3.12 ops/sec ±2.60% (12 runs sampled)|jsdom x 14.72 ops/sec ±1.94% (35 runs sampled)|
|querySelectorAll()|jsdom x 2.93 ops/sec ±1.52% (11 runs sampled)|jsdom x 12.41 ops/sec ±2.47% (31 runs sampled)|

For `closest()` and `matches()`, `nwsapi` is about 15 times faster, but in reality, `dom-selector` processed in 0.11 to 0.13 msec, so I don't think it's extremely slow.
Rather, it is `querySelector()` and `querySelectorAll()` that often have speed performance issues, and in this benchmark, `dom-selector` is about 4 times faster than `nwsapi`.

node.bodyText:
I noticed that the global window is accessible via document.defaultView.
So if dom-selector throws an exception like throw new document.defaultView.DOMException(), these try-catch can be completely removed, right?
Yes, that's right!

Thanks for the  quick reply.
I will rewrite the code and PR.

node.title: Add model for iCubGenova11
node.body:
The `iCubGenova11` is an iCub 2.7, so we generated the model accordingly.

It also fixes https://github.com/robotology/icub-models-generator/issues/255 to ensure that CI is green. I manually run the CI to push the generated files in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models/tree/addicubgenova11 for testing @martinaxgloria .

node.title: Fix for unneeded path fixing in Windows
node.body:
In Windows, there was an error (described in the linear ticket for this task). I _believe_ this is because in windows, there is no trailing slash included in the path, so there is an out of bounds error when trimming the path because of a -1 index.

However, I have no access to a Windows computer rn, so I cannot confirm that this works. However, I did the next best thing and had GPT review this error, and it came to the same conclusion and reasoning, so I'm pretty confident this should work... https://chat.openai.com/share/1b7c364c-9a91-4ac1-ba2e-f14e1560d2ef

---

Find the pull request instructions [here](https://www.notion.so/regressiongg/Pull-Request-Process-0d57a7eb582a446983edfacafa406f1e?pvs=4)

Every reviewer and the owner of the PR should consider these points in their request (feel free to copy this checklist so you can fill it out yourself in the overall PR comment)

- [ ] The code is extensible and backward compatible
- [ ] New public interfaces are extensible and open to backward compatibility in the future
- [ ] If preparing to remove a field in the future (i.e. this PR removes an argument), the argument stays but is no longer functional, and attaches a deprecation warning. A linear task is also created to track this deletion task.
- [ ] Non-critical or potentially modifiable arguments are optional
- [ ] Breaking changes and the approach to handling them have been verified with the team (in the Linear task, design doc, or PR itself)
- [ ] The code is easy to read
- [ ] Unit tests are added for expected and edge cases
- [ ] Integration tests are added for expected and edge cases
- [ ] Functions and classes are documented
- [ ] Migrations for both up and down operations are completed
- [ ] A documentation PR is created and being reviewed for anything in this PR that requires knowledge to use
- [ ] Implications on other dependent code (i.e. sample games and sample bots) is considered, mentioned, and properly handled
- [ ] Style changes and other non-blocking changes are marked as non-blocking from reviewers

node.title: Enhanced error handling in key functions
node.body:
# Enhanced error handling in key functions:
- Added specific exception handling to 'summarize' and 'get_next_action_from_openai' functions for improved reliability and debugging.
- Introduced granular error handling for FileNotFound, Permission, Image, I/O, Base64 encoding, API request, and other potential exceptions.

node.title: feat: improve footer
node.body: This PR aims at improving the footer of the website (navigation, logo, background of light theme). It is related to the issue #353 Still to be done : center the column -> help needed. ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **Documentation** - Updated the footer section with new links and sections for improved navigation and resource accessibility. - **Style** - Enhanced the footer's visual appeal with a new gradient background. - Improved the layout of the footer for better alignment and readability using flexbox properties.

#!/bin/bash
# Verify the URLs added to the footer. Expecting HTTP status 200 for all.
urls=(
  'https://okp4.network'
  'https://chat.openai.com/g/g-zUzcYmVbX-okp4-druid-oracle-beta'

  'https://explore.okp4.network/OKP4%20testnet'
  'https://faucet.okp4.network'
)

for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
  if ! curl --output /dev/null --silent --head --fail "$url"; then
    echo "URL check failed for $url"
  else
    echo "URL check passed for $url"
  fi
done

node.title: fix: Add cleanups in device,vlan and ports e2e tests to stabilise the CI pipeline

node.bodyText:
I believe that all of the occurrences of:
t.Error(err)
return

can be replaced by the following which provides additional logging context:
t.Fatal(err)

https://pkg.go.dev/testing#T.Fatal

A few more points are discussed here, https://chat.openai.com/share/4d97fa93-08b7-4e4d-8a7c-2343394a6ffe

we could handle the Close() and remapping of Stdout in a defer call so that it happens in error conditions
there are potential error conditions that are not being checked by the tests
Let's use the existing GenerateRandomString function (defined above) rather than adding a second function to serve the same purpose.

The random string should be generated once at the start of a test, and the same value should be used in all resource names for the test (so the test project and the test devices in that project should have the same random string in their names).

The project name prefix here should be passed in, not hard-coded to metal-cli-test-project; I see a couple orphaned projects from these tests, but I can't tell which tests they came from because of the generic prefix.
@aayushrangwala good call using t.Cleanup instead of defer. 👍
Ah right didnt notice as it recently got merged I guess
Done
Right. Fixed
Yes right. Fixed
The signature and implementation of this function shouldn't change; it should be used as-is.

The problem with the original function was that it would error out on smaller sized lengths - 5 for example. Somewhere in the history of this PR the random string length was modified from 32 to 5 and the E2E tests started failing.  We have seen more restrictive resource lengths introduced in the EM API, specifically around tags. I don't know if that was a motivation for the initial change.
Once the E2E tests started failing, I took a look at what would be needed to fix the base64-based GenerateRandomString function. The complexity hid the problem. As rewritten, the function can not fall into an error condition so the signature was modified to remove the unused error.  If we are ok with accepting that change in this PR, we'll see the echo of that change in this PR.
https://go.dev/play/p/Z2zkdK5lSEU
approving contingent on tests (which seem to be stuck)
